Reviews.Title: “I had a great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Angela G
Reviews.Content: I dont know what all these negative reviews are doing here, I had a great stay! Upon check in, I was greeted by both and manager and front desk girl, they were both extremely friendly and helpful. They had suggestions for places to go and eat, and even printed out directions for me. The rooms were a little tired looking, but still very comfortable. I dont think there are any prostitutes staying at this hotel, while I was staying there, there were a bunch of kids and families. The breakfast was really yummy. Lots of pastries and muffins, with flavors i'd never seen before. There was hot oatmeal, 3 different cereals. Overall I had a very pleasant stay and would definitely stay again when I come back to San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Getting what you pay for should be better...”
Reviews.Author: bocajrr
Reviews.Content: Reviews did not seem so terrible. I know that for a total of 75.00 during spring break is a great deal..BUT. My husband, myself and our three year old were just staying one night. We didn't need fancy just a place to sleep... 1. The picture shown is alot better than what it looks like 2. The room was dusty 3. The bed covers had burned holes in them, even though a non-smoking room 4. Drapes were askew so they wouldn't close all the way 5. The room was dumpy, definitely more like a one star hotel than 2 star. 6. No soap in shower or sink, when I called to tell them, the clerk rudely said I have plenty down stairs in the main lobby. I was on the third floor , elevator not working that day. 7 .Reviews on YELP that I checked later said that there were prostitutes on the first two floors, I didn't see any, but that does not mean there weren't any. Wish I would of checked those reviews first. I have stayed at other HO hotels before and they have always been decent, what a disappointment. I would of rather paid 30+ more than what I paid here. I had the feeling of bed bugs, std's , and fleas all night.

Reviews.Title: “An OK place to stay”
Reviews.Author: frogman2011
Reviews.Content: What more can you say for $49 a night in San Diego. Great location, very friendly and helpful staff, this is at the bottom end of SD budget rooms on hotel circle, so you get what you pay for, Room was clean but tired, and absolutely fine for what I wanted. WiFi at far end of the building is intermittent to say the least. bus stops outside and old town is close as well as shopping district in mission valley. Will you find better? yes, will it cost you more? yes a great deal more!

Reviews.Title: “This" Hotel" is HORRIBLE!!!”
Reviews.Author: ninac60933
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation at this hotel for myself, my husband and 2 yr old daughter, little did I know that the walls are paper thin ... you can hear the people next door having intercourse... There was no weather stripping on the doors or windows so all the traffic noise, and bugs got in. This was only the beginning, we stayed 6 nights, every night there was shouting on the staircases by our hotel door, drunken fools in the parking lot, and people with their t.v.'s blairing at 4 a.m., all which we complained about and recieved no help from the front desk. The room itself had torn and old comforters, stained walls and not very big at all. We have stayed on Hotel circle many times, and NEVER been so disappointed in a hotel as this last trip, I would never recommend this hotel to anyone, and even though you save a little money, it's not worth a goodnights sleep, and comfort... NEVER AGAIN!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location clean rooms but tired”
Reviews.Author: eyam
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel at less than $40 a night so we were happy with our stay. Rooms clean but tired. Staff very helpful especially Jose. Bus 88 outside hotel will take you to old town where you can pick up tram for downtown area. $5 all day ticket for bus and tram. Not alot of places to eat around hotel but Fashion island mall 1.5miles away with great food court. You can walk to Ricks diner from hotel and there is a mini mart 0.5miles up road for alcohol. You get quite a lot of road noise in hotel rooms but fridge and micro wave a bonus. Breakfast basic.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Motel but Beware of Billing Problems”
Reviews.Author: Tim_Messer
Reviews.Content: Overall I liked this motel much more than others here. The room was clean and quiet and the furniture was good. Bathroom was fine. WiFi was free and worked well. Room corridors are external. On-site vending machines are reasonably priced. The clerk refused to accept my coupon claiming that the room rate was already discounted enough. He also asked me to sign a blank visa credit card draft but didn't force me. I would stay here again if I needed to stay in this area again for some reason. One needs a car out here, of course. If I were a tourist in San Diego I'd probably stay downtown though.

Reviews.Title: “Only the staff made it tolerable”
Reviews.Author: Kitty904
Reviews.Content: Upon entering the Lobby, you will see a life sized statue of Hulk Hogan with tattered clothes. I'm sure it was cute at one time. The staff is very friendly and accomodating. The rooms are in dire need of some TLC. When I went into the bathroom, there were dark splatters on the wall, I have no idea what it was, but I was able to clean it off with a clorox wipe (the housekeeping staff should have cleaned it, it was obviously ignored). The areas around the doors were also dirty, and the sofa and carpet in the room can use a good steam cleaning. I had to remove some dust tags from above the table. When the walls are all white, dirt shows up clearly. I felt better once I did some cleaning of my own around the room. The first night, cops were on my floor, handling a disturbance. I think the person was allowed to stay, because I was disturbed 3 of the 7 nights I was there (2-3 a.m). I don't know why the Hotel allowed this person to stay after the cops were called that first night. As I wrote earlier, the staff is very good, the rooms, dingy. I wouldn't use the ironing board, either.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: missymoo85
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms were pretty clean ans spacious. The outside is quite shabby and could probably doing with being tidied up a little. We were right on the top floor and the whole place felt a little wonky, particularly when walking along landing to the room. It is quite noisy due to the highway but I am guessing most of the motels in the area have the same problem. We would definatley stay here again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Not THAT bad”
Reviews.Author: Herby S
Reviews.Content: I don't know if it was just our room, or they've improved recently, but our stay wasn't that bad. We went in and the first thing I did was to check the reviews for the hotel AFTER we were in the room (yes, that was bad planning). But after seeing the nasty reviews I was puzzled. Actually, the front desk people were corteous (even though the werestler "sculpture" in the lobby was creepy), the room was reasonably clean (thorough inspection revealed some dirt in the corners, but nothing like what other people claimed to have found) and the room was reasonably well equipped. No bug beds, nothing bit us through the night (and my wife is very sensitive to that sort of stuff). The room was a bit noisy due to the nearby highway, but not unbearable. We stood at room 101, maybe that's their only decent room. But it was a pleasant stay and had no problems ro report.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in room 315- BED BUGS!”
Reviews.Author: Misscer99
Reviews.Content: Don't stay in room 315- BED BUGS! Room 315 appeared to be like a normal dirty cheap motel (wish we would have spent the extra $20 for a better motel- or at least only paid Motel 6 prices.) Then my husband had bug bites all over him when he woke up. He went to the doctors yesterday because the bites turned into itchy welts. Doctor said he was bitten by bed bugs. The shower backs up. The building outside was dirty. The continental breakfast consisted of pastries and cereal. So not worth the amount of money they charge.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty!”
Reviews.Author: mperaji
Reviews.Content: The hotel has the necessities but dont come with high expectations. It is gross! Didnt like it at all. Very ghetto. The rooms are small. Bed sheets just creep you out. I would NOT recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Decent. Get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: chuck5519
Reviews.Content: When I checked in, I was first placed to a single bed room that smelled heavily of pot. The people next door to that room are to blame were going in and out, slamming the door. I asked to change rooms...and I'm pretty sure I was placed to a room next to hookers, but it smelled better and was quiet. This was no fault of the hotel staff, however prepare to put up with sketchy and hilariously rediculous people staying there. Overall, the staff seemed to genuinely care. The man who checked me in seemed very sympathetic. Room was pretty clean, slept well.

Reviews.Title: “Bad news bears”
Reviews.Author: Klbhehe
Reviews.Content: This place was pretty bad. I had some very sketchy stuff happen to me while staying here, someone banged on my door at 1:39am and then a creepy dude called our hotel rooms phone at 2 am asking how I was doing. Then I called the front desk and they said they didn't call my phone but someone from out side the Hotel could have.. Not normal and the place was a dumb filled with sketchy people.

Reviews.Title: “probably only has 3 stars cuz the manager goes on and rates it 5”
Reviews.Author: DeeDee029
Reviews.Content: This is by far the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. It was definitely NOT worth the money they were charging ($69+) I have stayed in many cheap motels, and have never experienced such a horrible stay. Unfortunately I'm not through my stay here as I have 6 more days left on our stay. If we could afford to move hotels and incur the cancellation penalty we would, but unfortunately we can't spend the extra money. We would even move to a different howard johnson, but again: the cancellation penalty. Here's a few things wrong (personally I think this whole hotel should be torn down.) -Bugs--probably spiders-- have been biting us during the night (even after changing rooms) -Dirty Carpets; we cant even take off our shoes without getting dirty black feet. As well as un-vacuumed in the corners (there was even a toothpick laying on the floor) -unclean shower and ripped towels. -their idea of pillows are fabric bags stuffed with foam. -restaurants are shoving their menus through the door everyday -AC broken -dirty walls, bathrooms,microwaves,tvs,tables, -couch/pull-out bed had a MASSIVE burn hole in it. Luckily we didn't have to use it. -Even in a Non-smoking room we can smell smoke. -the walls are so thin we can hear a conversation in the other room -continental breakfast includes cereal, old pastries, and gross coffee--I bring my own coffee down from the room since... -you can't eat the breakfast in your own room. -The building structure seems to be falling a part and the whole 4th floor is on an angle. Finally, the only good things: friendly staff the amenities are convientient (even tho gross) free parking and Wi-Fi I understand that this is a franchise and we can't just change reservations from one location to another, but the Howard Johnson name (under the 'proud members of the Wyndham Worldwide family) should take responsibility for their hotels! I don't know how this hotel passes any inspection--if they even get inspected. This location should be paying their guests to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Hotel with Dirty People”
Reviews.Author: cremebrulee0331
Reviews.Content: Utterly disgusting. I paid $108/night, so I thought it would be somewhat decent. I wasn't expecting 5 stars, but I was imagining something like a Comfort Inn or a Holiday Inn Express. But it turned out to be a more ghetto version of Motel 6. The room was tiny and the bed cover left your skin feeling dirty. If you squint very closely on the bathroom floor you'll see tiny insects (mites??) crawling. When you close the entrance door, you'll still see lights from around the rim of the door. And the other guests staying there were atrocious. There was a same dude wearing the same clothes sitting in the same stairway for 2 days drinking beer and staring at women that walk by. The free breakfast here was disgusting too. It kind of made me think of how a refugee camp would look like. Lots of dirty bodies in a small cramped damp room with a beat up bag of bread that people stick their hands in to grab a slice. GROSS!! We checked out after one day and paid double to stay at Marriott. The sheets there were actually clean. Never ever going back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling service, rude, bad hotel standards”
Reviews.Author: thewaytogohome
Reviews.Content: Okay, so it's not palatial - you get what you pay for after all. Although I am not sure where the free breakfast was, which was advertised on the big neon sign outside. The room and bathroom were reasonably clean etc etc, despite the rather noisy freeway view. It was just the lack of decent hotel standards and the seriously bad attitude of the staff who worked there which shocked both myself and my colleague. The first night, I stayed on the fold out coach in my colleague's room. You would think that, being a hotel, they would have perhaps, a few extra pillows and a few sheets. No. 'We're out of pillows,' the woman behind the desk said rudely. I was given one poor quality blanket and the last sheet. So far so bad. The next night was worse. During the day, the cleaner had taken all my bedding and folded the couch back up, so we had to call down for more sheets, blankets and maybe that all-elusive pillow. It was about ten o'clock at night. 'I'm really sorry about that madam. I'll send a sheet, pillow and blanket up to your room in ten minutes,' said the voice at the end of the phone. More than 20 minutes pass. No bedding. So I call reception and speak to another man who tells me 'no room service past ten o'clock'. Of course, I explained to him that the cleaner had caused us inconvenience, that his colleague had promised to send up the bedding. Mid explanation, the man hung up on me. So, fairly irritated, I went down the five flights of stairs (didn't want to risk the creaky elevator) only to interrupt another complaint by a lady and her husband. She was, quite reasonably, asking for a new sheet for her bed as it was dirty. She also needed some extra pillows for her kids' bed. 'We have no more sheets,' the man behind the desk said, rudely. 'We have no pillows.' He handed me, what turned out to be the last sheet, while the perplexed lady quite rightly asked him what the hell was going on. This was a hotel wasn't it? Didn't they have extra bedding? Most hotels would give you more than you need. She pointed out she'd spent $170 for the room. Deskman started getting angry. 'I didn't charge you for the extra bed in your room. You can go somewhere else if you don't like it.' By now it was midnight. The woman was speechless and began to protest. 'I think I have every right to complain if the hotel room is dirty, I've stayed at other budget hotels and...' Deskman then lost it. 'I am not renting out room to you. You make trouble. You leave.' 'But my two kids have moved in,' the woman said, flabbergasted. 'We can't leave now.' The pair then proceeded to have a mini tug of war over the blanket and sheet on the desk. I advised her to complain about this in the morning for fear of the poor woman being chucked out of her room with two kids in the early hours with nowhere to go. The standard of service in this place was shocking. The staff did not appear to give a damn about their paying guests. And seeing as the Howard Johnson is in the San Diego 'Hotel Circle', there are plenty of other budget options to choose from which surely cannot be half as bad as this.

Reviews.Title: “worth of what paying !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lockj73
Reviews.Content: i was on a business trip when i stayed at Howard Johnson. since it was not planned trip so i did not make reservation. i did early check-in without any problem and they give me pretty good deal because i'm staying for few days. the room i got was Q size bed with couch in the room with good space. i have got top floor of the hotel. this hotel got total 4 floor and they have elevator. in the room i have got refrigerator, microwave, iron with board, hairdyer, safebox, coffeemaker, and ofcourse TV with cable. they also provide chair and table in the room so peole like me do business work easily. in the morning they offer free continental breakfast, which incluse muffine, teacoffee, toast, fruite juice, serial, milk. they also offer free usa today. the staff was so healful, they help me with the navigation of my business destination in san diego. furthermore, they have free internet in the lobby with printer. so you may check in online and print your airplane ticket. that was very handy tool they offer. i would recommed this hotel to any one who is looking for nice hotel with good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Don't judge a book by its cover”
Reviews.Author: Rednecktraveller
Reviews.Content: From the oustside, this 60s-appearing motel looks like it is falling apart. Inside, though, the roms, if nit overly large, are comfortable and the selection of TV channels--over 70 of them--is all one could ask for. The vanity area and separate toilet/shower area have been remodeled, there is ample scalding hot water and the shower head delivers a comfortable volume of water. This is not a fancy place--at an average rate of $50.50/night for my stay, I did not expect one--but the location is convenient, the housekeeping service is efficient and the free breakfast has a satisfactory assortment of pastries, cereal and toast. As an older motel, it is somewhat noisy but again, if one wants peace and quiet, one can go down the street and pay much more.

Reviews.Title: “We had money stolen”
Reviews.Author: morenavancouver
Reviews.Content: I would not recomend this place besides the unfriendly , unhelpfull stuff, dirty old stained towels, money was stolen from us during our stay here. when i complain to manager/owner his reaction was: tough luck lady . How lousy can it get?!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: eaviles
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this hotel, altough they could have a better breakfast and the snacks machines could have worked better but it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “cheap but not too cheerful ... but great for TV”
Reviews.Author: autoflex
Reviews.Content: At $59 + tax this was a bargain, but I'm glad I didn't have to spend too much time here - and the time I did spend was occupied watching the TV (Showtime & HBO channels, but quite a few missing from the rest of the line-up), which helped drown out the noise of the traffic. Check-in clerk was almost incomprehensible, but room was perfectly adequate - clean and everything seemed to work OK (fridge included - didn't try the microwave or coffee-maker). Pool looked OK if you just wanted to get wet and/or had the standards of a 3-year old (I decided it would depress me too much to venture into the water with its views across the parking lot to the tenement-looking hotel). Hotel Circle South is good for access to Old Town and Hillcrest (take Bachman Place to the local shops and diners), visits to which enable you to forget where you're staying. I'm sure there are better places in the Circle than here (though the tv may not be as good).

Reviews.Title: “go hojo..................”
Reviews.Author: n2009p
Reviews.Content: i went to san diego with my friend it was sort of small trip. we stayed at howard johnson for 4 nights. it was nice to stay over there. they gave us good rate.the room was not enough spacious but it was quite clean and it was ok if you dont have too much baggage. in the room we had refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, and also a safe. they got 7 HBO and showtime. free parking. in the morning they serve free breakfast and also free USA today. the location of the hotel was perfect with I-8 pass by and also it is quite near to san diego attraction. the hotel staff was nice and help us lot with directions. in the back of hotel there was a pool and spa and also they got laundry. each day we got room service and they they also give us toiletry on asking for them. i would like to stay at same howard johnson again as it was nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not So Much”
Reviews.Author: kayenchanted
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at the hotel I found a barefoot clerk that looked like he was trying to get into the Guiness Book of World Records for Longest Fingernails – Most establishments have a dress code and require a certain level of personal hygeine, so I was a little put off by this. I arrived at my hotel room only to find that I had to shoulder-chuck the door to open it and employ a group of large men to manhandle it closed again. Upon entering the room I found that the cause of this inconvenience was the horribly warped and uneven floor. I was able to make my way safely across the floor to the balcony only to find that I had a view of the ghetto and a pool that looked like it was filled with stew rather than water and chlorine. Shortly after arriving at the balcony I realized that it was barely even attached to the building so I retreated to the “safety” of my room. Making my way to the bathroom I found myself letting out a sigh of relief that I still had my shoes on as the tiles covering the floor were so uneven that walking on them was more like an extreme sport or walking on broken glass. I was expecting to find that the shower didn’t even HAVE a floor, but to my surprise it did. All in all the place was disgusting and I will never return. But I suppose it could have been worse… Maybe?

Reviews.Title: “caused financial hardship”
Reviews.Author: Rhonee
Reviews.Content: 1st night:[ My disabled/elderly mom & her sister, my 16 yr old dghtr, & I went to CA for my son's MCRD graduation: we arrived @ Hotel about 9:20pm. Office was locked; sign on counter 'Be back soon' We stood in parking lot of strange town in dark 40+ minutes as there was no place to sit except a smoky stairwell before we were let in. The clerk 1st "pre-authorized" my debit card; then gave room number & key. Room was to have been non-smoking; it wasn't. The power went off/on 2 times: Clerk said breaker was ok. The tub wouldn't drain. I asked for a plunger/was told I could go get it. The clerk didn't offer to help, but did clean tub after I unclogged it.] 3rd day: Graduation day & our last day, I checked my acct bal: learned Hotel charged me $749.21 for 2 rooms: $369.21 TOO MUCH & caused $367 OD charges! This was Friday 10/5; Monday was a bank holiday, so this single mom &16 yr old were left with NO $$$ til 10/12th payday. My bank said "IF" the hotel would send them a letter stating they charged my account $369.21 in error and to release funds back to my account, they'd reverse the charges. The letter was not written per bank instructions, so $369.21 was reversed. My bank worked with me & reversed 3OD charges. After going back to TX, the GM offered $40 as Final settlement; not done til 10/10. The bank district mgr reversed 4 more OD charges. I contacted Howard Johnson's Customer Care Dept online/by phone for help the following weekend. Their rep said to contact hotel. In a 3rd e-mail it was written the office would settle for 50%, as the hotel did <no one mentioned that to me>, but since I wasn't satisfied I'd have to deal with the Hotel. I called again: the GM told me they'd done all they'd do. *I feel Howard Johnson should compensate me for the remaining $92 of $132 charges they caused*. I'm most disappointed w/HOWARD JOHNSON HOTEL, booked by a travel agency who won't recommend them again. They don't care about what they did... I don't recommend this place to anyone. but IF you stay watch your accounts

Reviews.Title: “Might as well charge by the hour...”
Reviews.Author: jeniroli28
Reviews.Content: I had never stayed in a Howard Johnson before, let alone a Howard Johnson Express. I got the chance last week when I was sent down for training. Training was to be held in the Doubletree thats just a few doors down (walking distance easy). My first reaction upon finding the "hotel" was, "Are you serious?" As I entered the "lobby", I was greeted by a life-size statue of Hulk Hogan... very classy I thought to myself. Checked in fine and as I make my way up the elevator and around the catwalk that wraps around the building 4 stories up, (sorry, scared of heights) I began to hope that my room would make up for what the "hotel" lacked in curb appeal. My hopes were crushed as I opened the door and the smell of smoke filled my nose and my eyes adjusted to the dark cave-like room. The room was small, very small, the bed was only a full (maybe a booking issue with personnel) and the lock on the door had to be jimmied in order to actually lock. What do you expect for $59 per night? Although, in all fairness to the "hotel", They did have a small fridge and a microwave in the room. The shower had also recently been re-tiled which was actually kinda nice. Would I ever stay there again? Definately not!

Reviews.Title: “Moldy, Dirty, just plain Filthy!”
Reviews.Author: charlie7957
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 day stay in San Diego. We only got about 2 hours of sleep the first night and 4 hours of sleep the next night. Not because of the noise, but because of the lack of comfort in this hotel. Our first room had so much mold in the bathroom that I had an asthma attack within 1 hour of being in there. We requested another room, only to have that room have no air conditioning. When going back to our original room, the cleaners had come in during our supposed transition into a new room and sprayed something that made the asthma so bad that I couldn't even enter the room. So we ended up with a 3rd try for a room. The 3rd room had mold as well but I requested them to not send anyone in to clean it - that I would clean it myself! Otherwise - we would have been searching for room number 4. The carpets in our first room and then our 3rd room were so dirty that the bottoms of my feet turned black within 2 hours of walking in the room barefoot. You may ask why we didn't leave the hotel? Well - the rooms were already paid for by credit card and we were tied into that hotel or we would lose the monies we paid and we couldn't afford that. We were so disgusted with the hotel that we ended up leaving the hotel at 7:00 AM to drive back home to Arizona and deal with the heat instead of staying in San Diego for the rest of the day and driving home that night. We thought Howard Johnson's was a 3 star hotel - with the rates we paid - it should have been. Next time we drive to San Diego, we will stay in a 4-Star hotel. The last time we drove to San Diego, 2 years ago, we stayed in a better hotel that was closer to the beach for considerably cheaper than this one. It was rated a 2 and was cleaner than this one. Manager wasn't around - we received no compensation or discount for these dirty rooms. Traveler Beware!

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: julie5000
Reviews.Content: Two problems. First, and worst, the room smelled like urine. It did not reak, exactly, but it was a strong enough smell that I could not put it out of my mind. It made the stay unpleasant, as you can imagine. Second, the ancient coffee pot in the room did not work. I asked if they could replace it or swap me one from a different room. I was told that there were no other coffee pots available. They also told me they did not have any ceramic/glass mugs, when I asked, in order to heat water in the microwave. (The alternative was to heat the water in styrofoam cups in the microwave). Since I got such a bad response on the coffee pot problem, I did not even try to get a different room with a better smell. Also, a minor point, breakfast was lousy, although that is not a big deal, given the price of the room. But for these problems, the price and in-room fridge and microwave would have made the deal okay. The furnishings and cleanliness were not otherwise terrible for a budget place. By the way, don't stay on Hotel Circle if you plan beach time. It was a good location for visiting the University of San Diego, but I don't know what else. There is a lot of traffic noise, although the air conditioner will drown that out for the most part. Any lure of an outdoor pool on this road should be ignored, since it is no fun playing in the pool with loud traffic noises very nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed @ this motel Dec 6 & 7, 2004. Rate was fair @ $69/night & staff was pleasant. Room was not the cleanest (complete with crawly critters in the bathroom). VERY noisy location right next to I-8. Sleeping past 7 am was impossible unless you are a really heavy sleeper. Did not feel particularly safe @ this establishment. Door to the room was accessible from the exterior of the property & although the door did have a lock it did not close very tightly. Breakfast consisted of toast or stale cereals & pastries. I understand that for the rate we paid we wouldn't get the Ritz, but would expect the bedding to be free of stains, the carpet to be relatively clean, the doors to close properly & the complimentary breakfast to be semi-fresh. There are LOTS of places to stay in this area, so I would look elsewhere on a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: cinmik89
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from August 1-2. The hotel was a bit hard to find as Hotel Circle is a complicated setup. Once we found the hotel, we could easily navigate back to it. Our room was on the second floor near the elevator. It was very spacious and clean. A refrigerator, microwave and safe in the room were all available to us. The air conditioner was loud for me, making sleeping difficult, but not for the other 3 members of my family. There was little space to put toiletries in the bathroom and little space to hang towels. The pool and hot tub are small yet very enjoyable for my 2 children. The continental breakfast provided daily was great! Several choices of bulk cereal (no little boxes here!), juices, milk, canned fruit, coffee and pastries (not the freshest, though) The breakfast is available in a large room with plenty of seating and a TV to watch the morning news. A USA Today is available free in the lobby each morning. There are machines near the elevator that sell snacks and bottled water. Outlet plus were lacking (as they were in each of the 4 hotels we stayed at during our California trip) so I would recommend bringing a power strip if you have things you want to charge. We felt we got a good value for the price paid and would stay again in this hotel if we were in the area.

HotelInfo.Name: Howard Johnson Express Inn - San Diego
HotelInfo.Address: 1631 Hotel Circle South, San Diego, CA 92108
